intro: Nemesia diffusa, commonly known as the common nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or biennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in early spring. Nemesia diffusa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
